intro: Lepismium alternatum, commonly known as the golden torch cactus, is a member of the Cactaceae family and is native to South America. It is a low-growing, spiny shrub that typically reaches heights of up to 1 meter. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a striking visual appeal. Its leaves are modified into spines, and it has a succulent stem that stores water. Lepismium alternatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
